solution_line_template: Jessica's pumpkin weighs half the weight of Brad's {brad_weight}-pound pumpkin so {brad_weight}/{half_divisor} = <<{brad_weight}/{half_divisor}={jessica_weight}>>{jessica_weight} pounds

Betty's pumpkin weighs {betty_multiplier} times the amount of Jessica's {jessica_weight}-pound pumpkin so it weighs {betty_multiplier}*{jessica_weight} = <<{betty_multiplier}*{jessica_weight}={betty_weight}>>{betty_weight}

Betty has the heaviest pumpkin at {betty_weight} pounds while Jessica's is the lowest at {jessica_weight} pounds so the difference is {betty_weight}-{jessica_weight} =<<{betty_weight}-{jessica_weight}={difference}>>{difference} pounds
